intro: Cnidium divaricatum, commonly known as the broadleaf cowplant, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cnidium divaricatum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
